p: Another good candidate for lead atom substitution in the perovskite materials is indium. In the work [ 34], a hydrothermal synthesis of zero-dimensional indium-based Cs 2InBr 5⋅H 2O single crystal with emission in red spectral region with PLQY of 33% was reported. The strong PL emission is due to self-trapping excitons, which are the result of structural deformation in an excited state. The transition between hydrated Cs 2InBr 5⋅H 2O and the dehydrated form is accompanied by a switchable double emission, which allows detecting water molecules motion in air or organic solvents ( Figure 2c).
